carpet.rule.xpbeacons.desc: if true uses experience-based amplitude on beacon status effects. See xp.fracturedcode.net
carpet.rule.beacon_duration_multiplier.d: effect duration in ticks= (9 + beacon level * beacon_duration_multiplier) * 20 according to the vanilla behavior
carpet.rule.beacon_max_pyramid_level.des: define the max pyramid level that affects the beacon. Use responsibly; a large pyramid could really start to lag things
carpet.rule.beacon_reach_multiplier.desc: (beacon_reach_multiplier * beacon level) + 10 = reach in meters according to the vanilla behavior
carpet.rule.beacon_tick_rate.desc: set beacon tick rate in game ticks per beacon tick
carpet.rule.haste_amplitude_ceiling.desc: effect amplitude ceiling for haste. default maybe a bit OP, play around with this one; mining obsidian is like mining stone without enchants or haste
carpet.rule.haste_xp_based_amplitude.des: toggle xp beacons for haste effect
carpet.rule.haste_xp_ceiling.desc: xp ceiling in levels for haste
carpet.rule.haste_xp_drain.desc: xp drain feature toggle for haste
carpet.rule.haste_xp_drain_rate.desc: xp drain rate for haste. each beacon tick takes away (haste_xp_drain_rate * effect amplifier) xp POINTS
